sect1.title: Updating an existing installation
sect1.para: If you are installing an update over an existing version by extracting files from the zip archive :
Go to Administration; Tools; Choose the option Database Update to update your database. You will not have to make a new installation, your data will be preserved without suffering any loss.

sect1.title: Minimum configuration and installation pre-requisites
sect1.para: Here are our recommendations for a minimum configuration to run PMB.
Go to Administration; Tools; Choose the option Database Update to update your database. You will not have to make a new installation, your data will be preserved without suffering any loss.

sect2.title: Standalone on Windows
sect2.para: PMB is a client/server web application. Nevertheless a number of sites use PMB in a standalone environment (only one computer) on Windows.

listitem.para: Intel Pentium processor or equivalent, 1 GHz minimum

sect2.title: Installation pre-requisites
sect2.para: PMB is a 3-tier application based on a typical web environment. In order to function, it will need :

listitem.para: Any web server capable of integrating the PHP scripting language
The PHP language to execute the scripts. The PHP language necessary specific features :
4.2 version or higher, not PHP 5 (some incompatibilities exist)
Optional modules for activating certain functions : YAZ for Z39.50 search, bz2 for the direct archiving of backups.
A MySQL database server, 4.0 version or higher
A new generation web browser (MS I.E. 6, Mozilla Firefox, Netscape 7, ...) platform independent : Windows, Linux, MacOS, UNIX, Solaris, BeOS...
Cookies must be enabled (not necessary for OPAC)
Pop-ups must be enabled (not necessary for OPAC)

sect2.para: It is possible to make PMB function on a standalone. In this case, server and client are one and same machine. The server's network address will be http://localhost/ or the IP address http://127.0.0.1/ both addresses directing to the local machine, that is, the client computer itself.
Similarly client and server can be different, either on the library's local network or via the Internet. Likewise it is possible to install the MySQL server hosting the database separately.

sect1.title: Rights on the server
sect1.para: To be able to use the function UNIMARC records upload from the Administration tab, the http service of your host need to have read/write access in the admin/import directory of PMB (which is normally the case). In addition your file must not be greater than a certain size (upload limit of your host).

Failing which the solution for importing UNIMARC records will consist in uploading the required file into the admin/import directory of PMB, by FTP for example, then choosing the option "pre-loading" from the import page in Administration. Your file must IMPERATIVELY bear the name unimarc.fic.
To be able to create barcodes, the web server need to have read/write access in the temp directory of PMB.
